Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Shay Mavis at (269) 243-2725.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Sometime over the last month, a former staff member provided
marijuana vapes to two youth at the facility on multiple occasions
when they would go for walks. The staff member quit two weeks
ago.
Additional allegation: Staff did not search belongings of new youth
placed at the facility so the marijuana the youth brought with him
was not found/confiscated.
Investigation This information was shared during an interview with Youth E
during a different investigation resulting in this Consultant
reporting the allegation.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A denied
ever seeing marijuana, vape pens, or breeze pens at the facility.
Youth A reported no staff have ever offered him marijuana or
vapes. Youth A denied ever seeing any staff vape while working
or hearing of any youth being provided marijuana or vapes from
any staff member.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B denied
any staff ever offering him marijuana or vapes. Youth B reported
the first day Youth A arrived at the facility Youth A smelled like
marijuana. Youth B denied having any knowledge of any youth at
the facility getting marijuana or vapes from any staff, past or
presently employed. Youth B denied ever seeing staff smoke or
vape while working. Youth B stated he has never heard any staff
talk about smoking marijuana.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, and April 30, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. Supervisor reported she never saw, had suspicion, or
heard youth say Staff 6 provided marijuana and/or vapes to any
youth. Supervisor denied ever seeing Staff 6 smoke or vape while
2

working. Supervisor denied having any knowledge of any staff
providing marijuana or vapes to any youth.
Supervisor stated Youth A’s belongings were not searched prior to
entering the facility. Supervisor reported Youth A was caught
smoking marijuana in the bathroom on Youth A’s first night and
found marijuana in Youth A’s coat pocket three days later.
Supervisor reported Youth B was caught smoking marijuana
recently. Supervisor stated Youth B said the marijuana was from
Youth A who had hid it under a rock after returning from a home
pass.
Director of Residential was interviewed face to face at the
facility on April 16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director of Residential reported the first night Youth A was placed
at the facility Youth A was caught smoking marijuana in the
bathroom. Director of Residential stated that a marijuana bud was
found in Youth A’s coat pocket one other time. Director of
Residential stated there was a breakdown in communication and
Youth A’s belongings did not get searched upon his arrival at the
facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 17,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
working with Staff 6 frequently when she was employed. Staff 1
denied ever seeing or hearing Staff 6 provided marijuana and/or
vapes to any youth. Staff 1 denied being aware of any staff
providing any youth with marijuana and/or vapes.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was caught smoking marijuana in the
bathroom the first night Youth A arrived at the facility. Staff 1
stated Youth A’s belonging did not get searched during the
admission process. Staff 1 described it is policy for every youth
and their belongings to be searched when they arrive at the
facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 30,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 denied ever
working with Staff 6 but knew who she was. Staff 2 stated she
has never seen any staff, past or present, provide marijuana or
vapes to any youth. Staff 2 reported she recalled reading or
hearing about Youth A getting caught smoking marijuana on his
first night arriving at the facility. Staff 2 described every youth,
and their belongings get searched when arriving to the facility and
when returning from home passes but sometimes youth can
sneak items by staff.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on April 30, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 denied ever seeing
any staff member, past or present, provide marijuana or vapes to
any youth. Staff 3 stated she heard from either youth or staff
Youth A was caught smoking marijuana the first night he arrived at
the facility due to his belongings not being searched. Staff 3
reported all the youth, and their belongings are to be searched
when arriving at the facility.
Staff 4 was interviewed via Teams on May 2, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 denied ever seeing
any staff member, past or present, provide marijuana or vapes to
any youth. Staff 4 reported Youth C was telling staff members
Staff 6 provided marijuana to some female youth (investigated in
2025SIC0000553).
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on May 9, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 6 denied ever seeing
any staff member, past or present, provide marijuana or vapes to
any youth. Staff 6 denied ever providing marijuana or vapes to
any youth. Staff 6 stated when she worked at the facility, she
could recall hearing or reading about youth getting caught trying to
sneak vapes and/or marijuana on campus after a home pass.
Staff 6 reported youth and their belongings always get searched
when arriving on campus and the youths’ bedrooms randomly get
searched.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on May 14, 2025. Staff 5
reported witnessing Staff 2 standing with some youths outside by
the ALC barn and it appeared Youth D was possibly vaping
because Staff 5 could see smoke coming from Youth D’s mouth
(being investigated in 2025SIC0000663). Staff 5 denied seeing a
vape, but suspected Youth D was vaping. Staff 5 stated this is the
only time she suspected a staff member provided a vape to a
youth but again stated she did not actually see a vape. Staff 5
denied ever seeing any staff member, past or present, provide
marijuana to any youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 6’s personnel file: There was no discipline record and
Staff 6 completed New Employee Orientation training from
11/04/24 – 11/15/24, which would have covered code of
conduct with youths. Staff 6’s separation form: Staff 6’s
last day worked 04/02/2025, employment ended
04/03/2025.
4

• Eagle Village Search Policy. Policy documents, “To ensure
the safety of youth and staff within the residential program
there may be situations in which staff will conduct searches
of a person, their belongings, and/or their room. Staff
should ensure youth and/or their belongings are searched
when they return to the house after being out of staff
supervision.”
• Incident Report for Youth A dated 3/13/25. Report
documents Youth A being caught smoking marijuana in the
bathroom at Hainley House. Report is consistent with
Youth B and staff interviews.
• Incident Report for Youth A dated 4/21/25. Report
documents marijuana was found in Youth A’s duffle bag
after returning from a home pass.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with the allegation regarding a
former staff member providing marijuana vapes to two youth at the
facility as per interviews conducted, there is no information to
support the allegation.
The facility is found in noncompliance regarding following facility’s
search procedures as per Youth B and multiple employee
interviews, the facility failed to complete a search of Youth A’s
belongings, which resulted in Youth A bringing marijuana into the
facility.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2025SIC0000379 dated 3/21/2025; CAP approval 4/04/2025
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
